job_description: Aid in the development of alkaline fuel cell back-up power systems through lab scale development and prototype build-up.  As a start-up company the work environment is fast paced, so flexibility and problem solving skills are paramount.The candidate must be able to do the following:- Safely conduct laboratory experiments and operate test equipment with minimal supervision.- Participate in continuous improvement of test systems.- Co-ordinate with technicians for sourcing and placing orders for materials, equipment, and supplies.- Participate in regular problem-solving/design sessions.
job_requirements: - Experience working in a lab environment using typical electrochemical lab equipment.- Experience working with hazardous/caustic materials and has shown the ability to follow work instructions safely and carefully.- Good mechanical aptitude with a hands-on approach.- Good organizational skills. Can manage multiple tasks and organize documents and data effectively.- Expert proficiency in the use of MS Excel and Word.Other Job Details- Candidates must be NSERC Eligible.- Candidates with completion of CHE 331 - Electrochemical Engineering will be considered first.- 8 month continuous term preferred.Open To All Majors:No
